page.title: 09The White Cross Estate (C)
page.content: The White Cross Estate was formerly owned by Storeys, who made rubber and plastic products.In 1981 Storeys closed the factory which employed 2000 people. In August 1983 the site was bought by Lancashire Enterprises Ltd, a company set up by Lancashire County Council to try and provide more job opportunities in the county at a time of high unemployment.At present this is 14.6% locally.Some of the buildings are being demolished but it is planned to keep and restore the stone buildings There are 46 activities catered for so far,including some rubber production, candle making and fibre-glass products. The site will also include social and residential zones.Some houses are to be built on that part of the site near to Springfield Steet.There is an office zone near the main entrance.
